name: saturable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to absorb or dissolve so much of something that no more can be added: Insulin is secreted by pancreatic cells and transported across the blood-brain barrier via a saturable transport system. This molecule binds to proteins in a saturable manner.
More examplesFewer examplesUptake of this hormone into the brain is a saturable mechanism.The process of binding is saturable and reversible. The processes responsible for the elimination of drugs are usually saturable.The saturable process seems to be related to vitamin D status.
